Description: Fragment of limestone cornice: the under-side is formed to simulate a roof made of tree-trunks. On the outer face is a single word, ʒpd' bird', in deeply incised signs. No colour survives.
Curator's comments: Formerly recorded on MI+ as found in the tomb of Idy at ABYDOS, but is clearly referenced in Petrie's Diospolis Parva volume as coming from Hiw.

This fragment, as Petrie says in ‘Diospolis Parva: the Cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. 1898-9’ (London, 1901), p. 37, formed part of the unusual cornice of the tomb of the lector-priest Idy. Bibliography. B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' V (Oxford: Clarendon Press), p. 108; W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Diospolis Parva: the Cemeteries of Abadiyeh and Hu. 1898-9’ (London, 1901), 37, pl. 25.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.42)
